text: قالوا۟ فاتوا۟ به على اعين الناس لعلهم يشهدون

translations.translation: Bring him before the people," they said, "that they may bear witness."
The others said: "Bring him, then, before the eyes of the people that they may see (what will be done to him)."
Their chiefs said, "Bring him before the eyes of the people and let them testify that he has spoken against the idols."
They said, “Therefore bring him in front of the people, perhaps they may testify.”
They said: "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may testify."
Said they: Then bring him before the eyes of the people, perhaps they may bear witness.
They said, 'Bring him before the people's eyes; haply they shall bear witness.'
They said: Then bring him (hither) before the people's eyes that they may testify.
They said, "Then bring him here in the sight of all the people, so that they may act as witnesses."
They said: bring him then before the eyes of the people, haply they may bear witness.
They said, ‘Bring him before the people’s eyes so that they may bear witness [against him].’
They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may bear witness."
They said: "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may testify."
They said: 'Then bring him here so that the people may see, so that they may bear witness'
They said, “Bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may witness.”
They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."
[21:61] They said, ‘Then bring him before the people’s eyes, that is, openly, that they may testify’, against him as being the perpetrator.

(They said) Nimrod said to them: (Then bring him (hither) before the people's eyes) in the presence of people (that they may testify) that he did it; and it is said that this means: that they may testify that he said he will demolish them; and it is also said that this means: that they may witness his punishment.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { فَأْتُواْ بِهِ عَلَىٰ أَعْيُنِ ٱلنَّاسِ } معناه أظهِرُوهُ ومثلُهُ جَاءوا بِهِ عَلَى رِءوسِ الخَلقِ

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: ثم لما انتشر الخبر واجتمعوا في المعبد مزدحمين متشاورين في انتقامه، واستقرارهم رأيهم عدماً تمادى مشورتهم إلى أن { قَالُواْ } متفقين: { فَأْتُواْ بِهِ } أي: بإبراهيم { عَلَىٰ أَعْيُنِ ٱلنَّاسِ } ورؤوس الملأ والأشهاد { لَعَلَّهُمْ يَشْهَدُونَ } [الأنبياء: 61] يحضرون ويجتمعون؛ يعني: جميع المعبودين لقتله وهلاكه، حتى ينال كل منهم نصيب حظه من نصر الآلهة

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: { قالوا } أي: السائلون: { فأْتُوا به على أعين الناس } أي: بمرأى منهم، بحيث يكون نصبَ أعينهم، لا يكاد يخفى على أحد، { لعلهم يشهدون } عليه بما سُمع منه، أو بما فعله، كأنهم كرهوا عقابه بلا بينة، أو يَحضرون عقوبتنا له
